topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537c0d196368720c1b0d0400#post_537c0d196368720c1b0d0400
I'm guessing they're playing around with the genetic engineering bits of the lore then.

Which really seems like a terrible idea, you don't want to pull people's attention too close to that particular plot device because frankly its kinda dumb and the only reason I forgive it is that it delivers dinosaurs.

Also are GIANT FUCK OFF DINOSAURS HUNGRY FOR FLESH not scary enough or something? Hell the scene in the original Jurassic Park where the T-Rex shows up is still one of the best horror scenes in film history in terms of build up and pay off.

topics.body:
"In this independent 2003 trial, consumers preferred GM sweet corn to non-GM sweet corn.":http://stagingtheseedstudio.com/olddd/BritishFoodJournal_Powell.pdf

Emphasis on *independent*, in case you can't read. A certain anti-GMO activist here still said that these studies were biased because they were allegedly industry-funded, even when they were explicitly shown to have independent, not industry, funding.

Citing NaturalNews against GMOs is like citing Answers in Genesis against evolution. In one article, it even promotes "applying a highly caustic substance to your skin to cure cancer":http://www.naturalnews.com/039803_Indian_black_salve_cancer_cure_herb.html. I'm pretty sure that destroys the credibility of the site alone.

I'm guessing he is under 21 but still considered an adult? If he were in Europe or Canada or pretty much any other country it would be no problem. If you live in pretty much any other country you can handle alcohol before 21 but as soon as you st foot in the US you instantly can't handle it at all until you turn 21, not a day before. Overnight you body magically transforms into a completely new being that automatically can now handle alcohol, you are a totally new person than you were the day before your 21st birthday.
